DOC.brief_title: A Study Assess Transfer Fospropofol Its Active Metabolite , Propofol , Breast Milk Following Administration LUSEDRA Lactating Women Undergoing Needed Procedure
DOC.detailed_description: E2083 , LUSEDRA® ( fospropofol disodium ) Injection , intravenous ( IV ) sedative-hypnotic agent indicate monitor anesthesia care ( MAC ) sedation adult patient undergoing diagnostic therapeutic procedures.1 It water-soluble , phosphono-O-methyl prodrug propofol . Upon IV injection , inactive fospropofol undergoes metabolism , notably alkaline phosphatase enzyme , yield active metabolite ( propofol ) , phosphate , formaldehyde . Formaldehyde quickly convert formate vivo , formate metabolize folate-dependent mechanism .
DOC.criteria: Inclusions : Lactating woman undergo needed procedure expect last approximately 10 45 minute Subjects 6 week 8 month postpartum Lactation must wellestablished subject Subject 's infant must full term able bottlefeed Infants predominantly breast milk feed receive one bottle formula per day Exclusions : Subjects pregnant Subjects undergo breast procedure ( eg , biopsy , abscess drainage , etc . ) Subjects willing temporarily refrain nursing child 024 hour breast milk collection interval . ( Subjects may resume nurse follow interval ) .
